markdownRemark.excerpt: Linear Algebra is a branch of mathematics that is widely applied in science and engineering. It is the study of linear sets of equations and their…
markdownRemark.html:
Linear Algebra is a branch of mathematics that is widely applied in science and engineering. It is the study of linear sets of equations and their transformation properties.

Zeros Matrix

def zeros_matrix(i=None, j=None):
    """
    A matrix filled with zeros.
    
    params:
        i : number of rows
        j: number of columns
    return: list of lists
    
    """
    
    if j == None:
        j = i
        
    M=[]
    #Create rows
    while len(M) < i:
        M.append([])
        #Enter values for each row 
        while len(M[-1]) < j:
            M[-1].append(0)
    return M
In []: zeros_matrix(3)

Out []: [[0, 0, 0], [0, 0, 0], [0, 0, 0]]

Identity Matrix

def eye(n=None):
    """
    Create an identity matrix for a square matrix
    params:
        n: number of rows and columns
    return: list of lists   
    """
    
    if (n == None):
        matrix = []
    else:
        matrix = zeros_matrix(n)
    for i in range(n):
        matrix[i][i] = 1
    return matrix  
In []: eye(3)

Out []: [[1, 0, 0], [0, 1, 0], [0, 0, 1]]

Matrix Addition

Matrices of the same shape can be added together Aij+Bij=CijA_{ij} + B_{ij} = C_{ij}Aij​+Bij​=Cij​.

[A1,1A1,2A2,1A2,2A3,1A3,2]+[B1,1B1,2B2,1B2,2B3,1B3,2]=[A1,1+B1,1A1,2+B1,2A2,1+B2,1A2,2+B2,2A3,1+B3,1A3,2+B3,2] \begin{bmatrix} A_{1,1} & A_{1,2} \\ A_{2,1} & A_{2,2} \\ A_{3,1} & A_{3,2} \end{bmatrix}+ \begin{bmatrix} B_{1,1} & B_{1,2} \\ B_{2,1} & B_{2,2} \\ B_{3,1} & B_{3,2} \end{bmatrix}= \begin{bmatrix} A_{1,1} + B_{1,1} & A_{1,2} + B_{1,2} \\ A_{2,1} + B_{2,1} & A_{2,2} + B_{2,2} \\ A_{3,1} + B_{3,1} & A_{3,2} + B_{3,2} \end{bmatrix} ⎣⎢⎡​A1,1​A2,1​A3,1​​A1,2​A2,2​A3,2​​⎦⎥⎤​+⎣⎢⎡​B1,1​B2,1​B3,1​​B1,2​B2,2​B3,2​​⎦⎥⎤​=⎣⎢⎡​A1,1​+B1,1​A2,1​+B2,1​A3,1​+B3,1​​A1,2​+B1,2​A2,2​+B2,2​A3,2​+B3,2​​⎦⎥⎤​ 
def shape(matrix=None):
    """
    Params: 
        matrix: A matrix that has rows and columns
    result: a list
    """
    return [len(matrix), len(matrix[0])]

Transpose

def transpose(matrix=None):
    """
    Create a transpose of a matrix ( Mij =>  Mji)
    params:
        matrix : a value, list or list of lists
    return: list of lists
    """
    
    if matrix == None:
        matrix = [[]]
    elif not isinstance(matrix, list):
        matrix = [[matrix]]
    elif not isinstance(matrix[0], list):
        matrix = [matrix]
    
    new_matrix = []
    for j in range(len(matrix[0])):
        new_vals = []
        
        for i in range(len(matrix)):
            new_vals.append(matrix[i][j])
        new_matrix.append(new_vals)
        
    return new_matrix
In []: transpose([1,2])
Out []: [[1],[2]]

In []: tranpose([[1,2,3],[4,5,6]])
Out []: [[1,4],[2,5],[3,6]]
